info.title: Collection Core API
info.description: Common APIs for collection production systems communications. Ensure main use cases (CRUD cases, clients, etc.) and serve as a foundation for the higher level APIs

externalDocs.description:
# System description

CollDesk is a debt collection system used in several Europen countries by Intrum Group (Spain, Italy, Belgium, Ireland, Portugal). It provides functionality to support all required features to handle debt collection processes end-to-end. CollDesk system is build on Oracle database platform (PL/SQL). Windows application is used by regular users to perform day to day activities; this windows application is distributed and deployed to each workstation; it is built using Microsoft .NET VB. This section provides information on resources CollDesk system API is exposing by using Collection Core APIs as data model.

# Authorization

CollDesk sAPI uses OAuth 2.0 authorization. Before you can invoke an API, API access should be received. Click on "Request access" button, and "Request API access" form will appear. Before access can be requested, a client application must be created. Click on "Create a new appliation", fill in the "Application Name" parameter and check "Client Credentials Grant" in "OAuth 2.0 Grant type" section. After the client application was created, please follow steps below to generate the token:

* If you are mocking a service in exchange, you need to fill in "Authorization" form:
  * Authorization method - OAuth 2.0 authorization
  * Select OAuth 2.0 grant type - Client Credentials
  * Set authorization data:
    * Client id - client id you received, after you requested an access for your client application
    * Client secret - client secret you received, after you requested an access for your client application
    * Access token URL - https://kc.intrum.com/auth/realms/mulesoft/protocol/openid-connect/token
    * Scopes - openid
  * Set redirect URL - can remain unchanged
* If you are using Postman, you need to get new access token in "Authorization" section
  * Same data should be provided in the form
  * When token is requested, select it in the "Available token" section

# Exposed resources and methods

Current CollDesk sAPI implementations supports Collection Core APIs methods listed below. Additional services can be developed per request if such need will appear. Parameter "clientId", which specifies client identifier in the production system, should be provided as a query parameter.

### Get Cases

* GET /cases - _gets cases by client id_
* GET /cases/{caseId} - _gets case by case id_

### Get Transactions

* GET /cases/{caseId}/transactions - _gets transactions for specified case id_
* GET /cases/{caseId}/transactions/{transactionId} - _gets specified transaction for specified case id_

### Get Customers

* GET /cases/{caseId}/customers - _gets customers for specified case id_
* GET /customers/{customerId} - _gets customer information for specified customer id_

### Get Clients

* GET /clients/{clientId} - _gets client information for specified client id_

get.description: Searches for the cases by given criteria

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: List of the client IDs in given production system

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: List of phone numbers

parameters.name: additionalFields
parameters.description: Specifies list of the additional information to be included int response of the cases list. To be used if standard list of fields is not enough. If specified, data provider to ensure that listed entities are populated

parameters.name: Client-Application-Id
parameters.description: Disclose original information of a client connecting to a web server

items.title: Collection case
items.description: Definition of the collection case as it is seen by the consumer. Initial draft from customer portal's perespective. This specification is created based on Customer portal use case. NB! To be evolved for the actual data model. See http://confluence.intrum.net/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=32179006 for detailed information

clientId.description: Client production system specific unique identifier

clientName.description: Name of the client as per production system

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

caseConcern.description: This is a descriptive text of what the debt is about, e.g. text ”Phone bill for April 2015”, ”Bank loan, agreement number 6363267”, and similar. The same text typically shows up as a heading on collection letters etc.

mainStatus.description: Catalyst main status code of the case

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs
ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

closingCode.description: Catalyst case closing code. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Closing+Codes for details.

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

productId.description: Catalyst product identifier. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Product+Identifiers for details

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs
ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

customers.description: List of all customers assigned to the case. This field is returned only if requested via additionalFields query parameter during get cases or get cases by case ID call

items.description: Case specific customer information. This is generic customer information enriched with the properties meaningful within case scope only

language.description: Code of the default language used by the debtor

contactInformation.description: List of the know contact information items

items.description: Definition of the single contact information item

type.description: P = fixed phone; M = mobile phone; F = fax; E = email; O = other

value.description: Actual contact information (e.g. email address or phone number, etc.)

scope.description: Defines where contact information leads (e.g. home phone , work phone, etc.) NB! Consider speciication of the possible values

customerId.description: Main unique identifier of the customer; SSN, personal code or other identifier if customer is a person, company registration number if customer is a company

addresses.description: List of the known addresses for the debtor. At least one address to be defined

items.description: Common definition of the address

type.description: Type of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Type for details

status.description: Status of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Status for details

postalCode.description: ZIP code of the specified address

state.description: State, county or similar of the address

countryCode.description: 3 letters code of the country for the address. Consider having enum here

gender.description: Gender of the person. Applicable for person debtors only

type.description: Main debtor's type. P = person, C = company

debtorRowNumber.description: This is a number that identifies a debtor record (so not necessarily a person). It is production system-generated; it could be a row ID for the debtor record or internal (production system generated) debtor identifier - the second one is preferable. It is used in Catalyst to relate records to each other, for example, which 3200 record that a specific 3209 record belongs to. This number is not hashed in Catalyst as it does not identify a person.

type.description: Customer type within the scope of the given case

status.description: Identifies customer status related to the given case

isMain.description: Identifies whether given customer is main within scope of the given case

suspension.description: Defines customer suspension information within scope of the given case

enabled.description: Defines whether collection is suspended or not

comment.description: Optional comment on the suspension reason

date.description: Date when suspension is set (only if enabled)

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

status.description: High level status of the case

interestDate.description: Date until which interest has been calculated last time.

comments.description: Any comments for INTRUM relevant to the case

caseCurrency.description: Main case currency identifier (3-letters currency code AS PER ISO-4127)

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

items.description: Transaction definition from production system perspective. See http://confluence.intrum.net/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=32868222 for more details on transaction information

amountCode.description: Another way of classifying the booking, usually more detailed than transaction type. Also indication whether the booking applies to capital, interest, fees, outlays, or some other category

paymentPlanId.description: ID of the installment plan under which this payment or charge is made

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

debtorRowNumber.description: This is a number that identifies a debtor record (so not necessarily a person). It is production system-generated; it could be a row ID for the debtor record or internal (production system generated) debtor identifier - the second one is preferable. It is used in Catalyst to relate records to each other, for example, which 3200 record that a specific 3209 record belongs to. This number is not hashed in Catalyst as it does not identify a person.

functionCode.description: Fields functionCode and amountCode are additional classifications of the booking. The classification depends on how bookings are classified in the local collection system. The values are chosen by the country (so no common list of valid values)

invoiceId.description: If the booking applies to a specific invoice in the case, then put the ID of that invoice here

debitAgainst.description: Indicates the balance agains which booking applies. 0 = Creditor; 1 = Debtor. NB! Catalyst sets this value as mandatory

/cases/{caseId}/payment-plans.x-amf-description: Payment plans manipulation endpoint. Provides possibilities to request available payment plan options, request new payment plan and get information on ongoing one

get.operationId: Get payment plan proposals or active payment plan
get.description: Get payment plan information for given case. Scope of the information is defined by the "status" query parameter.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: INTRUM internal client number as per given production system

parameters.name: debtorNumber
parameters.description: Customer ID

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Payment plan start date

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Payment plan status - PROPOSAL, returns payment plan options available for the case (these options are ready to use and should they are selected automatically confirmed by production system); ACTIVE - returns currently active payment plan for the given case

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: Case ID in given production system

parameters.name: Client-Application-Id

/payments.x-amf-description: Payments manipulation endpoint. Provides possibility of payment registration with production system

post.description: Notify production system on successful payment on the obligation. Assumes that payment is booked right after notification and list of transactions is updated accordingly. If payment cannot be booked in sync mode production system is expected to create pending transaction and update it to confirmed after booking is completed

get.operationId: Get latest payment by given criteria
get.description: Get latest payment by given criteria

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: Case ID in given production system

parameters.name: Client-Application-Id
parameters.description: Disclose original information of a client connecting to a web server

schema.title: Payment specification
schema.description: Case payment specification. Payments are normally booked against obligation, but it is also possible to book directly to the case for further detailed booking carried by the production system. See http://confluence.intrum.net/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=32868214 for details on payment details

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

x-amf-union.description: Unique identifier of the obligation. Consists of two parts connected with ::, where first part is case identifier and second part is debtor identifier, both specific to the given production system. NB! Check validity of the pattern!

invoiceId.description: Invoice sequence number or original id to which payment to be booked

type.description: Describes the way how payment was made. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Payment+type for types description

clientPayerReference.description: Client payer reference. ADD MORE DETAILED DESCRIPTION

clientPaymentReference.description: Client payment reference. ADD MORE DETAILED DESCRIPTION

/clients.x-amf-description: Clients information manipulation endpoint. Allows new client creation and listing of the paticular client's information

post.description: Create new client in given production system

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: Provide an url to the newly created resource

schema.description: INTRUM Client definition. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/710+Client+record for more details on client specification

clientId.description: INTRUM internal client number as per given production system

companyId.description: Unique public identifier of the client (e.g. VAT number)

parent.description: Parent INTRUM client number to ensure client's organization hierarchy

accounts.description: Client's bank receiver information. In portals this one is used in customer portal (DW) to show information to the customer should he or she wishes to transfer money directly to client's account

items.description: Generic bank account information

iban.description: IBAN account number of the client

bankGirot.description: Bank GIROT of the receiving bank

addresses.description: All addresses available for the client

items.description: Common definition of the address

type.description: Type of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Type for details

status.description: Status of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Status for details

postalCode.description: ZIP code of the specified address

state.description: State, county or similar of the address

countryCode.description: 3 letters code of the country for the address. Consider having enum here

/customers/{customerId}.x-amf-description: Common resource type for the single item. Assumes authentication and enforces format of the different methods' requests and responses

get.description: Returns specific customer information from the givenproduction system

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: INTRUM internal client number as per given production system

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Unique customer identifier (debtor number) in production system

schema.description: Customer (debtor) definition from client case perspective. For customer case debtor's definition see Obligation. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/3200+Debtor+record for more information

type.description: Main debtor's type. P = person, C = company

customerId.description: Main unique identifier of the customer; SSN, personal code or other identifier if customer is a person, company registration number if customer is a company

gender.description: Gender of the person. Applicable for person debtors only

language.description: Code of the default language used by the debtor

contactInformation.description: List of the know contact information items

items.description: Definition of the single contact information item

type.description: P = fixed phone; M = mobile phone; F = fax; E = email; O = other

value.description: Actual contact information (e.g. email address or phone number, etc.)

scope.description: Defines where contact information leads (e.g. home phone , work phone, etc.) NB! Consider speciication of the possible values

addresses.description: List of the known addresses for the debtor. At least one address to be defined

items.description: Common definition of the address

type.description: Type of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Type for details

status.description: Status of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Status for details

postalCode.description: ZIP code of the specified address

state.description: State, county or similar of the address

countryCode.description: 3 letters code of the country for the address. Consider having enum here

put.description: Requests update of the customer information. It is expected that production systems will be able to validate the updated data and provide synchronous response whether the update is accepted or not

parameters.description: Unique customer identifier (debtor number) in production system

post.description: Authenticates customer by given username and password, where username is normally case ID within the scope of production system. Used for simple authentication of the users in customer portal. Returned identifier is used to request customer's obligations

schema.description: Customer credentials as in claim letter
Information of the customer for the identified case

language.description: Code of the default language used by the debtor

items.description: Definition of the single contact information item

type.description: P = fixed phone; M = mobile phone; F = fax; E = email; O = other

gender.description: Gender of the person. Applicable for person debtors only

type.description: Main debtor's type. P = person, C = company

suspension.description: Defines customer suspension information within scope of the given case

enabled.description: Defines whether collection is suspended or not

comment.description: Optional comment on the suspension reason

date.description: Date when suspension is set (only if enabled)

isMain.description: Identifies whether given customer is main within scope of the given case

debtorRowNumber.description: This is a number that identifies a debtor record (so not necessarily a person). It is production system-generated; it could be a row ID for the debtor record or internal (production system generated) debtor identifier - the second one is preferable. It is used in Catalyst to relate records to each other, for example, which 3200 record that a specific 3209 record belongs to. This number is not hashed in Catalyst as it does not identify a person.

type.description: Customer type within the scope of the given case

status.description: Identifies customer status related to the given case

/obligations.x-amf-description: Obligation (customer specific view of the case) manipulation endpoint

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: Case ID. Used for obligations for strong authentication method

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Login distributed to the customer via demand letter, normally case number. Used for weak authentcation method which allows multiple cases visibility

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: A unique debtor identifier within production system. For countries using SSN, it most likely will be SSN. Normally taken from /customers/search call.

parameters.name: debtorRowNumber
parameters.description: Debtor Row Number. Used for weak authetication allowing one case only visibility

items.title: Customer obligation
items.description: Customer specific view on the case, called obligation.  This is how particular customer sees the case if he or she would be th eonly customer associated with the case. Obligations are only applicable for the customer viewpoint to the case. Uniquely identified particular customer within given case and may provide addtionla specific inofrmation

status.description: Status of the case from customer perspective

debtorRowNumber.description: This is a number that identifies a debtor record (so not necessarily a person). It is production system-generated; it could be a row ID for the debtor record or internal (production system generated) debtor identifier - the second one is preferable. It is used in Catalyst to relate records to each other, for example, which 3200 record that a specific 3209 record belongs to. This number is not hashed in Catalyst as it does not identify a person.

/obligations/{obligationId}/messages.x-amf-description: Common resource type for the collection of the items. Assumes authentication and enforces format of the different methods' requests and responses

post.description: Send message from the specific case customer to the production system

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: Provide an url to the newly created resource

schema.description: Structred message to be delivered to production system from customer. This is always on case level and for the given customer assigned to the case. Structure of the message is dynamic and can be dictated by the local operations

id.description: Message id as per source application

obligationReference.description: Unique identification of the sender (customer on case level)

type.description: Common identification of the message type NB! Create enum for the types

attachments:schema.description: List of files attached to the message

items.description: Definition of the file being attached to the resource (e.g. pdf of the original invoice or odf of the claim letter sent to the customer by Intrum, etc.)

type.description: Type of the document in attached file

fileName.description: Name of the file as defined in common file storage

date.description: Date relevant to the document if attached file. May be used by production system to notify customer or client on exact date when document was produced or sent out

body.description: Message type specific data structure, which can be influenced by the local oprations. This structure assumed to be ready for consumption by given production system
